questions.question_text:
A user in Cisco Unified Communications Manager Administration has been added to the Standard CCM Admin Users group, which includes the Standard
CCMADMIN Administration role, but the user cannot add new users. What is the cause of this issue?

discussion.content: C. The add user capability has been disabled for the role.

choices.D: Only the CCMAdmin user can add users.
choices.C: The add user capability has been disabled for the role.
choices.E: Users can be added only via LDAP C
choices.B: The incorrect group and role were assigned.
choices.A: The add user capability has been disabled for the group

questions.question_text: IP WAN failure has occurred. Which two configurations must be made to allow calls to or from an IP phone at a branch location to complete to a destination outside of that branch? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
A. Survivable Remote Site Telephony is configured on the branch router.
C. Call Forward UnRegistered option is configured on each branch phone profile. 
Both options have to be configured for calls FROM and TO the branch in case of WAN failure.

C. Call Forward UnRegistered option is configured on each branch phone profile.
E. An ISDN is configured as a primary survivable backup site

choices.D: POTS WAN failover is set to Survivable Remote Site Telephony.
choices.C: Call Forward UnRegistered option is configured on each branch phone profile.
choices.E: An ISDN is configured as a primary survivable backup site CE
choices.A: Survivable Remote Site Telephony is configured on the branch router.
choices.B: LAN failover configuration is set to Survivable Remote Site Telephony.

questions.question_text: Two IP phones configured in the same office have a phone call in progress when the Call Manager they are registered to fails. Which result is true?

discussion.content: C. The call remains active, but features such as MOH and Transfer are unavailable for the rest of the call.

choices.A: The call remains active, and the Cisco IP Phones enable SIP proxy mode for RTP.
choices.D: The call is immediately disconnected. C
choices.B: The call disconnects after the RTP/RTCP keepalive between the IP phones and Call Manager fails.
choices.C: The call remains active, but features such as MOH and Transfer are unavailable for the rest of the call.

questions.question_text: Which two errors cause a Cisco phone to reset? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
B. The TCP connection fails while connected to Cisco Unified Communications Manager
C. Proper keep alive is not received from Cisco Unified Communications Manager

choices.D: The IP address is incorrectly configured
choices.C: Proper keep alive is not received from Cisco Unified Communications Manager
choices.A: The MAC address is not registered in Cisco Unified Communications Manager and change is applied
choices.B: The TCP connection fails while connected to Cisco Unified Communications Manager
choices.E: The device does not receive timing from Cisco Unified Communications Manager server BC

questions.question_text: A voice engineer is setting up Cisco Jabber IM and must provide visibility for users not on their contact list. Which feature must be enabled to allow this visibility?

discussion.content:
Answer is C, the key here is "for users not on their list"
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/voice_ip_comm/cucm/im_presence/configAdminGuide/10_5_1/CUP0_BK_CE43108E_00_config-admin-guide-imp-105/CUP0_BK_CE43108E_00_config-admin-guide-imp-105_chapter_01100.html#CUP0_TK_C9A10ECA_00

I think A as well
Enable availability sharing
Default Setting: On
Check this checkbox to enable users (clusterwide) to share availability information (assuming that the privacy policy set by the user allows for this capability). 
If you turn on this setting, the IM and Presence Service shares availability information for a user amongst all other users in the cluster who are subscribed to that user's presence, based on the policy settings for that user. The default policy setting for a user is to allow all other users view their availability. Users configure their policy settings from either the client (Cisco Jabber) or the Cisco Unified IM and Presence User Options interface.

Shouldn't the aswer be A?
"To turn off availability sharing for all clients in the IM and Presence Service cluster, uncheck Enable availability sharing.. If you turn off this setting, IM and Presence Service does not share any availability to other users in the IM and Presence Service cluster, nor does it share availability information it receives from outside the cluster. Users can only view their own availability status."
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/voice_ip_comm/cucm/im_presence/configAdminGuide/10_5_1/CUP0_BK_CE43108E_00_config-admin-guide-imp-105/CUP0_BK_CE43108E_00_config-admin-guide-imp-105_chapter_01100.html
